title: Mount Reynolds
text: Mount Reynolds () is a snow-capped <a href="mountain">mountain</a>, 1,130 m, marked by steep, rocky lower slopes, standing at the south side of <a href="Violante%20Inlet">Violante Inlet</a>, on the east coast of <a href="Palmer%20Land">Palmer Land</a>. Discovered by members of the <a href="United%20States%20Antarctic%20Service">United States Antarctic Service</a> (USAS) in a flight from <a href="East%20Base">East Base</a> on 30 December 1940. Named by the US-SCAN for Jeremiah (John) <a href="N.%20Reynolds">N. Reynolds</a>, longtime protagonist (1826–38) of American exploration and expansion in the Pacific and the Antarctic.
